result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L Verdine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samantha L Verdine is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samantha L Verdine was found guilty of Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

RELEASING FUNDS - $125.05 to J & T's Family Foods

2:14 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - restitution of $125.05 has been paid in full and goes over prior offer of a fine and costs.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  $200 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 2:21 p.m.
Status hearing at 04-27-2015 01:00 pm

1:06 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the court - has paid a $100.00 of the restitution.  Statement by defendant, does not want an attorney and work schedule does not permit to meet with the DA.  Statement by DA - recites offer, if restitution is paid in a reasonable time, will recommend a fine and costs.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 27, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
Status hearing at 04-20-2015 01:00 pm

1:32 P.M.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, will not be getting an attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Statement by DA - def can pay restitution on friday.  Court will set for status hearing on April 20, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:34 p.m.
Status hearing at 04-06-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant called and requested an adjournment.  Defendant was advised that she can have one adjournment.  Matter adjourned to April 6, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  Address on file is correct.
